messages.title: Personal Message
messages.content: Thirteen years ago Labour were elected promising change, But today, with your economy in a mess and a growing gap between rich and poor, a lot of people feel let down. Perhaps you're one of them. I'm writing today to tell you that you don't need to give up hope for a fairer, stronger country. The Conservative Party has the energy and ideas to change Britain.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Committed to the NHS, intending to increase spending and improve it for everyone.
Aims to get the economy moving by tackling the debt and over two years create 400,000 new apprenticeships, training places, and work pairings.

Will stop Labour's jobs tax which will kill the recovery, meaning seven out of ten working people will be better off than under Labour. Will help council tax for two years. Will raise the basic state pension freeze council tax and protect winter fuel payments.
Make Britain the most family-friendly country in Europe, keep tax breaks with free TV licenses for older people and will make passes and travel free.
Supporting Britain in improving Sure Start and providing 4,200 extra Sure Start health visitors.

issues.economy: Aims to get the economy moving by tackling the debt and over two years create 400,000 new apprenticeships, training places, and work pairings.
issues.environment: Make Britain the most family-friendly country in Europe.
issues.health: Committed to the NHS, intending to increase spending and improve it for everyone.

leaflet.personalStatement: I am personally committed to the NHS, so we’ll increase spending and improve it for everyone.

quotes.text: The choice at this election is clear: five more years of Gordon Brown's tired government making things worse or change with the Conservatives.

images.caption: David Cameron interacting with various groups and individuals.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet encourages the recipient to choose to vote for change, implying a need to shift away from the Labour Party towards the Conservative Party.
